Posts.Content: May 13, 2009 11:26AM mraven wrote: What a coincidence, I am 22 and I have an ultrasound scheduled for today as well. I wouldn't dwell on the veiny part a lot, I think it probably varies from woman and woman, I myself have very veiny breasts. As to your lump question, mine is quite big, feels like two large peas stuck together, although the doctor quoted "I don't expect there's reason to be concerned" which has helped me be less nervous about the ultrasound. The mind can do remarkable things to your body, which can inturn freak you out. I can sure tell you that your body can throw strange pains and aches at you which aren't related to your fear, although you should still be aware of them. Bring up your fears about the aches and pains so that you can be reassured. It seems to me that you are looking way too closely for symptoms, I would try not to analyze yourself and let the tests run their course and ask questions.
Posts.Title: 23 years old and need ultrasound...help! bartosma noworriesbehappy

Posts.Content: May 15, 2009 03:04AM mraven wrote: I am very sorry that you have to go through this. I am 22 and have had a cancer scare as well with a biopsy coming up, so I know what it's like to have your whole life ahead of you. I will hope the best for you and your results.
